column5: Well hit the kawarthas last weekend,to try and hit a few smallies using my new shimano crucial 7ft dropshot rod !!! and well we hit probly about 12 or so,and when we decided to switch over to do a few trolls over a promising deep hole beside a weedbed,well i hit this nice musky while trolling a bouncer,with one of my homeade worm harnesses,and well the fight was on !!! i noticed early on that he was hooked pretty good,right through the top of the mouth,and was suprised he didnt break me off after doing a few 30yrd dashes,as im only using 8lb. 100% berkley flourocarbon!!! but he made it to the net,was measured,and a few pics taken,and back to the lake in a short minute,she was 43"inches !!!!...so here she is along with a few smallies that we caught !!! and man is that new crucial dropshot rod awesome !!!...oh ya and she is an entry for team #12 catch 22  ....cheers
congrads.....that ski looks awwsome    cheers    pete
Great stuff Shawn!!  Landing it on 8lb test is awesome....good to see you still getting out there....great pics!
Well done, nice fish!
Nice fish!....ok...now i'm really jealous.....lol
Great report and pics fishindevil  She's a real beaut Thanks for sharing Leechman
Nice fish Buddy.And add another 43" for Catch 22.Way to go.
Very nice fish Shawn.  Jeez, you're just hoisting it up like its nothing, I need to work out more  Joey
nice going on the fish, they get real scrappy when they start to get into the 40's,looks like you had some ideal weather too..can't ask for much more than that
BOO   to the vertical hold Sean!

Nice fish Shawn, your getting lot's of big ones this year gotta love those big surprises. I already got us a 46" for Catch 22 put up a couple weeks ago and added a 19" smallie yesterday, we got a good average but really need a catfish and carp and non great lakes trout if anyone can go for them. If you go to the bottom of the page and click on Tourney Entries all our pics are in there, been updating whenever possible.  My first musky ever was walleye fishing with a worm harness as well. I think if we made a monster worm harness with a #10 Colorado blade, size 7 hooks tipped with a big Gardner snake it could be deadly all year, lol.
Awesome fish Shawn.......all of them!   I cant believe you got the musky on a worm harness!!!  WTG!  Bill
Great catch! I still haven't manage to catch my musky this year yet.
Congrats,  That's a beauty.  The vertical will cause some grief (pssst hold the sign in yer teeth!!).  8lb. line!!!  Amazing.
WTG Shawn, some real real nice fish there.
Have had Muskie take my worm harness and what a ride. Thats a nice one you got, couple good bass as well, WTG...
Great fish and excellent photos, Shawn. Good on ya.
nice ski and bass
as usual great photographer
8LB line and a worm harness.....that must have gotten your heart pumping!   Congratulations Shawn.    Great way to show how well your harnesses work!

Great catch, and on 8lb mono to boot.  My first musky was also caught walleye fishing. Hope you got a flak jacket for the vert hold, these musky guyz are gonna be foaming at the mouth.  I figure you for a great angler, I'm sure she swam off nicely.
Awesome job!! Thanks for the report and pics.  Cheers, 1leg
Nice Musky! gots some nice teeth on her!
No foaming mouth here! But someone had to say it!
Nice Musky and some decent smallies!!! More muskies are caught on pickerel and bass gear than musky gear!
